question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.body:

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, AND will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

(2) Will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This resolves as Yes if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Resolves No otherwise.

This question will resolve as Yes if both (1) and (2) resolve as Yes.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President, AND will Kamala Harris's chances of winning rise in the coming week according to Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden make a statement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign publicly and officially announces that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election. If such a declaration is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this will be considered No.

(2) Will Kamala Harris's chances of victory improve over the next week according to Nate Silver's analysis? This will be Yes if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. It will be No otherwise.

This question will resolve as Yes if both (1) and (2) are Yes.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make an announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not be accepting the Democratic nomination for President, AND will the likelihood of Kamala Harris winning rise over the next week according to Nate Silver's projections?
para_P.body:
(1) Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not be pursuing the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not seek or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be explicit and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle. If such a declaration is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this will be considered No.

(2) Will Kamala Harris's chances of winning improve over the next week according to Nate Silver's projections? This will be considered Yes if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. If not, it resolves as No.

The overall question will be answered with Yes if both (1) and (2) are answered with Yes.

para_P.title: Is Joe Biden going to publicly state before July 15, 2024, that he will not be accepting the Democratic nomination for President, AND will the chances of Kamala Harris winning increase over the next week based on Nate Silver's forecasts?
para_P.body:
(1) Is Joe Biden going to announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not be seeking the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official declaration that he will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination in the 2024 election cycle. If such an announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this will be marked as No.

(2) Will Kamala Harris's likelihood of winning rise in the next week according to Nate Silver's forecasts? This will be marked as Yes if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model surpasses 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. If it does not, it will be considered No.

The overall question will receive a Yes response if both (1) and (2) receive a Yes.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's passing prior to the market's closure at the conclusion of Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it resolves to NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if an official statement regarding Joe Biden's death is made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. 

If no such announcement occurs, it will be regarded as a NO.

para_P.title: Could Joe Biden die before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be deemed a YES if there is an official announcement about Joe Biden's death prior to the market's closure on Friday, July 26th. 

If no such declaration is made, it will be interpreted as a NO.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden continue to be President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (An Acting President is distinct from a President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still be in office as President by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (i.e. appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (The Acting President is distinct from the President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden remain in his role as President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if Biden is still serving as the President of the United States by the close of July 2024 (Eastern Time); it will be a NO if he resigns, dies, or ceases to be President before that time.

A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (such as designating his Vice President as the Acting President) does not lead to a YES outcome. (According to the Constitution, the Acting President is not the same as the President.)

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, and (b) Joe Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). It resolves NO if either condition is not met. Note that a temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not affect the resolution of condition (b).

para_P.title: Is it possible for Joe Biden to pass away prior to Saturday and still hold the position of President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: (a) An official declaration of Joe Biden's passing occurs before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, and (b) Joe Biden continues to serve as the President of the United States until the end of July 2024 (ET). It will be considered negative if either of the criteria is not fulfilled. Please note that a temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment does not influence the determination of condition (b).

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden pass away prior to Saturday and continue as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) An official declaration of Joe Biden's passing occurs before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, and (b) Joe Biden stays in the role of US President until the end of July 2024 (ET). It will be deemed negative if either criterion is not fulfilled. Please note that a temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment does not influence the determination of criterion (b).

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will die before Saturday and remain in the presidency until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered in the affirmative if both of the following conditions are met: (a) An official announcement of Joe Biden's death is made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, and (b) Joe Biden continues to serve as the President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET). The answer will be negative if either condition is not satisfied. Please be aware that a temporary shift of power under the 25th amendment does not affect the assessment of condition (b).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, July 26th, 2024, or (b) Biden does not remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

(b) Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This includes if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday, July 26th, 2024, or (b) Biden is no longer President by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, it resolves NO.

(b) Resolves YES if Biden does not continue as US President until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET). This includes scenarios where he resigns, dies, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (i.e., designating his VP as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution, as Acting President is not the same as President according to the Constitution.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday, July 26th, 2024, or (b) Biden is no longer in office as President by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, 2024. If not, it will be marked as NO.

(b) This will be marked as YES if Biden is not serving as US President by the end of July 2024 (ET). This encompasses scenarios where he resigns, dies, or otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary power shift under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his VP as the Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution, as Acting President is constitutionally distinct from President.

para_P.title: Could either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday, July 26th, 2024, or (b) he is no longer serving as President by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th, 2024. If this does not happen, it will be marked as NO.

(b) This will be marked as YES if Joe Biden is not in the position of US President by the conclusion of July 2024 (ET). This includes situations where he resigns, passes away, or otherwise ceases to be President before that date. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (like appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution, as the role of Acting President is constitutionally different from that of President.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be barred or excluded from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially barred or excluded from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The barring or exclusion is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude with a "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the given provisions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred or excluded from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not barred or excluded from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

The exclusion or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reputable media sources. Speculative accounts, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that might take place *after* the specified date. It exclusively addresses whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated provisions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or prevented from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

The answer will be "No" if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account any legal challenges, appeals, or subsequent developments that may occur *after* the specified date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the mentioned provisions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, thus not being barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve in the negative.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This question may take into account new candidates that may emerge in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it is not significant who obtains the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is exclusively based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be the chosen candidate for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Donald Trump is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** resolution. This question may take into account new candidates that may emerge later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.body:

For this question, the specific nominee from the Republican Party on the date of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; the focus is solely on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or barring must be validated through official state government announcements, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative narratives, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may take place after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

The exclusion or prohibition must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documentation, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

This inquiry will be deemed "No" if these conditions are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that might happen after the specified date. It strictly addresses whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or prohibited from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not excluded or prohibited from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

para_P.body:
This question will be answered "Yes" if, by July 15, 2024:

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if at least one of the following scenarios takes place:

(a) Donald Trump has been formally disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. The disqualification or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and is then reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve as "No."

(b) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. All other candidates will resolve as "No." This question is open to other candidates that may emerge in the future.

The question will resolve as "No" if neither condition (a) nor condition (b) occurs.

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s move to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, claiming it suppresses the vigorous ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, based on information from a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, serves as the first public indication from Democrats following the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their colleagues are still quite concerned about the prospects of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman mentioned in an interview. He chose not to confirm whether the letter exists.

This market will conclude with a YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if there are multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures, that would also be enough to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not satisfied by the market close, the market will resolve to NO.

(b) At least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20: Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If at any time before midnight July 20 Central Time, there are 10 or more Democratic Senators, this market will resolve to yes. If not, it will resolve to no.

(b) Will there be an extra debate for the Democratic party presidential hopefuls? This will be considered YES if a debate takes place among potential Democratic nominees (like Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the general public in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

Here, "accessible to the general public" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (possibly requiring a subscription fee). If it is not accessible in certain EU nations (as occurred in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to specific groups (like minors), the question will still resolve positively, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

The term "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. The question will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries to systems powered by Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Widely accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (as was the situation in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to certain groups (such as minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome if more than 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be considered a positive outcome if the name or website changes, provided that OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be readily available in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will receive a response of **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is readily available in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Readily available" indicates that the typical circumstance for individuals in the EU is that they can utilize it without the need for a VPN (although it may require a fee). If it is not accessible in particular EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to certain demographics (such as minors), it will still be regarded as a positive outcome if over 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" pertains to the standard web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. It will still be viewed as a positive outcome if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Members or Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Two of the most vulnerable Democrats have informed local news outlets that they’ve already dismissed Biden’s prospects for victory in November.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one is expected to request Biden to conclude his campaign, as per five individuals familiar with the discussions.

This market will resolve to YES if at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to encourage Joe Biden to think about ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to press him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be through signing a letter as mentioned above, or it might take another form, such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively ask him to withdraw.

This market stipulates that all five individuals must be part of the same group communication. Five individuals individually informing reporters that they believe Biden should step down will not be adequate for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats requesting Biden to resign will not fulfill this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the market's closing date. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed to a reasonable degree, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to exit the race. Two of the most vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local news outlets that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are bleak.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these drafts would request Biden to terminate his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with these efforts.

This market will conclude with a YES if a coalition of at least five specified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborates to ask Joe Biden to contemplate withdrawing from his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through the signing of a letter as mentioned above, or through another method, such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively requesting him to step down.

For a YES resolution, it is essential that all five individuals participate in the same group communication. If five individuals independently express to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw, this will not be adequate for a YES outcome.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats requesting Biden to resign will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's closing date. In instances where names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will tend towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th AND will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message, and their names must be made public before the end date.

2. Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

If both of these criteria are met within their respective time frames, this question resolves YES. If either or both are not met, it resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a coalition of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw before July 20th, and will Biden declare by July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if both of the following stipulations are satisfied:

1. A coalition of at least five specified Democratic Party US House Representatives or Senators collaborates to encourage Joe Biden to contemplate terminating his 2024 re-election bid, or to press him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could involve signing a letter or an alternative method such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively requesting him to withdraw. All five individuals must be part of the same collective communication, and their identities must be disclosed publicly before the deadline.

2. Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue and will not accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear-cut and final, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

If both of these conditions are fulfilled within the specified time frames, this question will resolve in the affirmative. If either or both conditions are not fulfilled, it will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw before July 20th AND will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed a YES if both of the following stipulations are satisfied:

1. A coalition of no fewer than five specified Democratic Party members from the US House of Representatives or US Senators collaboratively request Joe Biden to contemplate terminating his re-election campaign for 2024, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could manifest through methods such as endorsing a letter or engaging in a group dialogue with Biden, collectively urging him to step aside. All five individuals must be part of the same collective request, and their identities must be disclosed publicly before the deadline.

2. Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue nor accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election. The announcement must be unequivocal and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

If both of these conditions are fulfilled within their respective time limits, this question will resolve as YES. If either or both conditions are not fulfilled, it will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of five recognized Democratic members of the House or Senate put pressure on Biden to withdraw prior to July 20th AND will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not seek the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are met:

1. A group of at least five identified members of the Democratic Party from the US House of Representatives or US Senators jointly urge Joe Biden to consider halting his re-election campaign for 2024, or to strongly persuade him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time). This could occur through actions such as signing a letter or participating in a collective discussion with Biden, collectively urging him to withdraw. All five individuals must be part of the same unified request, and their names must be made public before the deadline.

2. Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek nor accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election. The declaration must be unequivocal and final, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

If both of these conditions are satisfied within their respective timeframes, this question will resolve as YES. If either or both conditions are not satisfied, it will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th? (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Will a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time)? This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this resolves NO.

(b) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this resolves as No.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that: (a) A collective of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House Representatives or US Senators will urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th? (b) Joe Biden declares prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) Is it possible for a coalition of at least five specified Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators to collaborate in requesting Joe Biden to contemplate ceasing his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)? This could take the form of a signed letter or another method, such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively request his withdrawal. All five individuals must be part of the same group communication. Five individuals independently informing journalists that they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats contacting Biden and asking him to step aside will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the conclusion of this market. If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, this will resolve as NO.

(b) Will Joe Biden make a statement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's presidential nomination? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official announcement stating that Joe Biden will not seek or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unequivocal and definitive. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this will resolve as No.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either of the following will take place: (a) A coalition of at least 5 identified Democratic House Representatives or US Senators will press Biden to withdraw before July 20th? (b) Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) Is it likely that a coalition of no fewer than five specified Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators will collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate ceasing his 2024 re-election efforts, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)? This could manifest through a signed letter or another method, such as a collective meeting with Biden where they collectively implore him to withdraw. All five members must be part of a singular group communication. Five individuals independently expressing to the media that they believe Biden should exit the race is insufficient. Any reports concerning an unspecified number of Democrats contacting Biden and urging him to resign will not meet the requirements of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market closes. If these conditions are not satisfied by July 20th, the outcome is NO.

(b) Is it expected that Joe Biden will publicly announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official declaration stating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unequivocal and definitive. If such a clear statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, the outcome will be No.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that one of the following events will occur: (a) A group of at least 5 designated Democratic House Representatives or US Senators will urge Biden to step down before July 20th? (b) Joe Biden will announce by July 15, 2024 that he will not seek the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) Is it possible that a coalition consisting of no fewer than five specific Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators will join forces to ask Joe Biden to consider halting his 2024 re-election campaign, or to strongly persuade him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time)? This could be evidenced through a signed letter or another approach, such as a joint meeting with Biden where they collectively urge him to withdraw. All five members must be involved in a single group communication. Five individuals independently stating to the media that they believe Biden should exit the race is not sufficient. Any reports regarding an unspecified number of Democrats contacting Biden and encouraging him to resign will not fulfill the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the market closes. If these conditions are not met by July 20th, the answer is NO.

(b) Is it anticipated that Joe Biden will make a public statement before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's presidential nomination? This will be deemed Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official announcement stating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unequivocal and definitive. If such a clear announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, the answer will be No.

This will be considered TRUE if both of the following criteria are met: (a) there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th, and (b) a woman is selected by the Democratic delegates as the presidential candidate for the 2024 election. 

This will be deemed FALSE if either of these criteria does not happen.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday (b) The 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee is a Woman?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

(b) Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following happens: (a) Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday (b) A Woman is chosen as the 2024 Democratic Presidential Candidate?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, it will be NO.

(b) This will be deemed “yes” if and when the Democratic delegates choose a woman as the presidential candidate for the 2024 election. It will be considered “no” if and when the Democratic delegates choose a man as the presidential candidate for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following happens: (a) Joe Biden passes away prior to Saturday (b) The Democratic Party's nominee for President in 2024 is a woman?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered a YES if there is an official confirmation of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. If not, it will be a NO.

(b) This will be marked as “yes” if and when the Democratic delegates choose a woman as their presidential nominee for the 2024 election. It will be marked as “no” if and when they select a man as their nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that either of the following occurs: (a) Joe Biden dies before Saturday (b) A woman is chosen as the Democratic Party's presidential nominee for 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be recorded as a YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, it will be a NO.

(b) This will be noted as 'yes' if and when the Democratic delegates select a woman as their candidate for the presidential election in 2024. It will be noted as 'no' if a man is chosen as their candidate for the 2024 election.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

"""

If this occurs, it would set a record for the largest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film. question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
