question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Vivek Ramaswamy going to be the nominee for the Republican Party in the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election in the US. Any other candidates will be regarded as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 election; it is exclusively based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Vivek Ramaswamy going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by who is elected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the nominee for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This question will yield a **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected as the nominee by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This inquiry is not confined to the candidates currently in the race; new contenders may emerge later.

For the purposes of this question, it is irrelevant who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it solely hinges on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: Is it possible that Rishi Sunak will not be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Rishi Sunak does not secure election as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election scheduled for July 4, 2024.

Conversely, if Sunak is successful in being elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency during the July 4, 2024 UK general election, the outcome will be **No**.

The resolution must reference [reliable](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news sources, or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is running (if he is indeed a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: Is Rishi Sunak going to be unsuccessful in his bid for election during the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Rishi Sunak does not secure a position as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election taking place on July 4, 2024.

Conversely, if Sunak is chosen as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the UK general election on July 4, 2024, the answer will be **No**.

The resolution must reference [reliable](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media sources, or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is a candidate (if he is indeed a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: Will Rishi Sunak fail in his attempt to win a seat in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a **Yes** if Rishi Sunak does not obtain a role as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election scheduled for July 4, 2024.

On the other hand, if Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency during the UK general election on July 4, 2024, the response will be **No**.

The answer must be based on [reliable](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news sources, or an official declaration from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is running (if he is indeed contesting in any constituency).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (2) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

For the first condition, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For the second condition, resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency). If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this part will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both (a) Vivek Ramaswamy will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Rishi Sunak will not win a seat in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (2) Rishi Sunak does not succeed in being elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024.

Regarding the first criterion, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

As for the second criterion, resolution should reference [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news sources, or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is running (if he is indeed a candidate in any constituency). If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4, 2024 UK general election, this portion will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Rishi Sunak does not win a seat in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This question will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (2) Rishi Sunak does not secure election as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024.

Regarding the first criterion, it does not matter who is nominated for the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; what matters is who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For the second criterion, resolution should rely on [reliable](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news sources, or an official statement from the returning officer of the district where Sunak is running (if he is indeed running in any district). If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any district in the UK general election on July 4, 2024, this part will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will both of these events occur: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Rishi Sunak fails to gain a seat in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Vivek Ramaswamy is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (2) Rishi Sunak does not achieve election as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election scheduled for July 4, 2024.

Concerning the first condition, the identity of the Republican nominee on election day in 2024 is irrelevant; what is significant is who is designated by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For the second condition, the determination should depend on [trustworthy](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news outlets, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is contesting (if he is contesting in any constituency). If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the UK general election on July 4, 2024, this aspect will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

For part (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For part (b), if Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this part will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Rishi Sunak does not get elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Rishi Sunak does not succeed in being elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024.

Regarding part (a), the identity of the individual who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; what matters is who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Concerning part (b), if Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency during the July 4, 2024 UK general election, this part will be resolved as **No**. The resolution should reference [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media sources, or an official declaration from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is standing (if he is contesting in any constituency).

para_P.title: Is it possible for Vivek Ramaswamy to become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or for Rishi Sunak to lose his bid in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Rishi Sunak does not get elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024.

Regarding part (a), the individual who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election is not relevant; the determination is exclusively based on who the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) select.

For part (b), if Sunak wins a seat as a Member of Parliament in any constituency during the July 4, 2024 UK general election, this part will resolve as **No**. The resolution should reference [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media sources or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is running (if he is indeed a candidate there).

para_P.title: Could Vivek Ramaswamy secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or might Rishi Sunak face defeat in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following occurs: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024.

Concerning part (a), the identity of the individual nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election is not pertinent; the outcome is solely dependent on the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

As for part (b), if Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament in any constituency during the UK general election on July 4, 2024, this part will conclude as **No**. The resolution should rely on [reputable](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news outlets or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is contesting (if he is indeed a candidate there).

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the European Union will declare new tariffs or duties on imports of electric vehicles from China prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be considered **Yes** if reliable sources indicate that, before July 5, 2024, the European Union (EU) has made an announcement regarding the imposition of new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the European Union will declare new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be considered **Yes** if credible sources indicate that, before July 5, 2024, the European Union (EU) has made an announcement regarding the imposition of new tariffs or duties on the import of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Could the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on the import of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if reliable sources suggest that the European Union (EU) has declared, prior to July 5, 2024, the implementation of new tariffs or duties concerning the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a coalition of at least five identified Democratic House Members or Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local media that they have lost hope in Biden's ability to win in November.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more intense. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these would request that Biden terminate his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with the situation.

This market will resolve YES if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party House Members/Senators collaborate to ask Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be through signing a letter as mentioned above, or it could take another form, such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively requesting him to withdraw.

It is required that all five individuals be part of the same group communication. Five individuals independently expressing to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw does not suffice for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden asking him to step aside will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are publicly disclosed prior to the market's closing date. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

para_P.title: Will a coalition of no fewer than five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have informed local news outlets that they believe Biden has no chance of winning in November.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more intense. There are several drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats, and at least one of them would urge Biden to conclude his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with these efforts.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborates to request Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of signing a letter as mentioned above, or it could occur in another manner, such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively requesting him to withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals participate in the same group communication. If five individuals independently express to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw, that will not be enough for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats contacting Biden and asking him to step aside will not fulfill the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's closing date. In any unclear situations where such names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will tend to resolve to NO.

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Will a group of at least five named Democratic House Representatives or US Senators apply pressure on Biden to step down before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two representatives from secure districts have already publicly urged Biden to withdraw. Moreover, two of the most at-risk Democrats have told local media that they think Biden has no chance of success in November.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more heated. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats, and at least one of them would advocate for Biden to end his campaign, as reported by five sources familiar with these initiatives.

This market will conclude with a YES if a coalition of no fewer than five identified Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators works together to ask Joe Biden to consider halting his 2024 re-election campaign, or to strongly persuade him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could manifest as signing a letter as mentioned earlier, or it could occur in another way, such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively urging him to withdraw.

It is crucial that all five individuals partake in the same group communication. If five individuals independently convey to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw, that will not suffice for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and requesting him to step aside will not meet the market's criteria unless at least five qualifying names are made public before the market's closing date. In any ambiguous situations where such names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will likely resolve to NO.

If these conditions are not met before July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (b) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as collectively speaking with Biden. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Reports of unnamed democrats will not satisfy the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before July 20th. Ambiguous cases will resolve NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) The European Union declares new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024, and (b) A coalition of at least 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators press Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024?

Reports of unnamed Democrats will not meet the requirements unless at least 5 qualifying names are disclosed before July 20th. Unclear cases will be resolved as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) The European Union declares new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024, and (b) A collective of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators press Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024?

para_P.title: Could both of the following events occur: (a) The European Union imposes new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (b) A group of at least 5 known Democratic House Members or US Senators urge Biden to withdraw from the presidential race before July 20, 2024?

Reports of unnamed Democrats will not meet the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are disclosed before July 20th. Situations that are ambiguous will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will Greece qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Greece does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Greece going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Greece competes in a Semi-final and is formally recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Greece fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Is Greece going to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Greece takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Should Greece fail to qualify, the response will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will Greece qualify for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This question will receive a response of **Yes** if Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially acknowledged by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. If Greece does not qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

For this question, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

(a) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not run for or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be explicit and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden might accept the nomination.

(b) One of the following individuals is chosen as the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

If neither (a) nor (b) takes place, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to stay in office until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden continues to serve as the US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still hold the office of President by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President at the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (An Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden remain in the presidential position until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if Biden is still serving as the President of the United States by the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be a NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before that date.

A temporary transfer of power as per the 25th amendment (like appointing his Vice President to act as President) does not result in a YES outcome. (An Acting President does not equate to the President as defined by the Constitution)

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be marked as "No" if these circumstances are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen *after* the specified date. It solely relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

(a) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. (b) This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if Biden continues to be the U.S. President until the close of July 2024 (ET); it will be marked as NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary handover of authority under the 25th Amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES outcome. (Acting President is distinct from President according to the Constitution).

(b) The resolution to this inquiry will be "Yes" if, by July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially prohibited or removed from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal role (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This prohibition or removal must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reputable media reports. Mere speculation, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not suffice for resolution. The outcome will be "No" if these stipulations are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. Note: This query does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or reversals that may occur after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal role based on the cited criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified from a ballot and then later reinstated, so that as of July 15th he is not disqualified from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Biden continues as President until the end of July 2024 and (b) Donald Trump is barred or eliminated from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered TRUE if Biden is still the U.S. President at the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); it will be deemed FALSE if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary power transfer under the 25th amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a TRUE outcome. (An Acting President is distinct from a President as defined by the Constitution).

(b) This inquiry will be affirmed as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially barred or eliminated from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The barring or elimination must be confirmed by official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The question will be answered "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may take place after the specified date. It solely relates to whether Donald Trump has been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred from a ballot and then reinstated such that as of July 15th he is not barred from any ballot, the question will be answered negatively.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater likelihood of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, this market will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a higher chance of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. In the event that both candidates have equal probabilities, this market will resolve to a 50-50 outcome.

The definitive source for this resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations in the methodology employed by FiveThirtyEight to derive its figures will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will settle based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is accessible. The market may not reach a conclusion until the data for July 20 is available. Should there be no data for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve using the closest prior figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the probability of each candidate winning expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The count of simulations from 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be taken into account.

(a) Kamala Harris: This will be marked as yes if Kamala Harris is named the Democratic Vice Presidential nominee. If someone else is appointed as VP, it will be marked as no. A change in the Vice Presidential selection after the initial choice will not influence this outcome. The determination can be made immediately following the nomination.

(b) Larry Elder: This will be marked as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will receive a **No**. This is strictly based on the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will five or more identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators compel Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two secure-seat members have already publicly encouraged Biden to step aside. Two of the most vulnerable Democrats have informed local news outlets that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these would request that Biden end his campaign, as per five individuals familiar with the situation.

This market will resolve to YES if a collective of at least five identified Democratic Party House Representatives or Senators collaborate to urge Joe Biden to contemplate terminating his 2024 re-election campaign, or to press him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of signing a letter as mentioned above, or it could occur through another method, such as a group meeting with Biden in person and jointly requesting him to withdraw.

This market stipulates that all five individuals must be part of the same collective message. If five individuals independently express to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, it will not suffice for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and asking him to step aside will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the market closes. In any unclear situations where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards resolving NO.

If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Will a single country secure victories in multiple women's team sports during the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold medals in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Conversely, the same NOC must have claimed victory in at least two of these competitions for the answer to be **Yes**.

question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden be in office as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES outcome. (An Acting President is not the same as a President according to the Constitution.)

para_P.title: Is Biden expected to hold the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden is still the President of the United States at the end of July 2024 (Eastern Time); it resolves to NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution, as the Acting President is not considered the President according to the Constitution.

para_P.title: Will Biden remain in office as president until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be marked as YES if Biden is still serving as the President of the United States by the conclusion of July 2024 (Eastern Time); it will be marked as NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before that date.

A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (like appointing his Vice President to act in his place) does not count as a YES outcome, as the Acting President is not recognized as the President under the Constitution.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

The medal standings are determined by tallying the total medals earned by each competing nation and ranking them by:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of ties for the first position) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of ties for the second position) Total Bronze Medals.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, will he achieve at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are set to close on July 6. One poll solicits votes from Manifold participants for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other requests votes for a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public opinion typically indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat included in hypothetical scenarios is polling either ahead or within the margin of error. Do Manifold participants reflect the general population?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the result of this formula for the first poll minus the formula for the second poll is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve to N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

This market will conclude with a YES if Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or more when both polls have closed.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the result of the first poll's formula minus the second poll's formula is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

These polls and this question will not resolve as N/A and will remain open until the designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

Public opinion research often reveals that Joe Biden lags behind Donald Trump by a margin exceeding the error range, while every other Democrat evaluated in hypothetical contexts is either leading or within the error margin. The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but no more than 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will determine if Donald Trump has a lead over Joe Biden within the range of greater than 3 and up to 4 in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 based on the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden exceed 3 but remain under 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved by assessing the margin by which Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as presented in the chart for July 15, 2024, when evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number reflects a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates Biden is in the lead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which is represented as a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Vivek Ramaswamy going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered with **No**. This question is open to the possibility of additional candidates being included in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is elected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For this question, it is irrelevant who the Republican Party nominates on the day of the 2024 US election; the decision is strictly based on who is elected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. The lead must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4 according to 538's national polling average, and (b) will Vivek Ramaswamy be the chosen Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. The margin must be greater than 3 and at most 4.

(b) This question will be answered as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered as **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates listed below; additional options may be included later. It is determined solely by the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is it possible for both the following events to take place: (a) Trump's margin over Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Vivek Ramaswamy become the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude as Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. The margin must be greater than 3 and not exceed 4.

(b) This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced later. The outcome is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Can both of the following scenarios occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden exceeds 3 but is no more than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Vivek Ramaswamy secures the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be answered based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as recorded on July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive margin indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative margin indicates a lead for Biden. The margin must be more than 3 and not exceed 4.

(b) This question will be answered as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. Any other candidate will lead to a **No** response. This inquiry is not restricted to the candidates currently in consideration; new candidates may emerge later. The final determination is solely based on the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions are met: 

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this condition, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This condition is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 3 but be 4 or lower in 538's national polling average, or will Vivek Ramaswamy secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following criteria is fulfilled: 

(a) The lead of Donald Trump over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential race is more than 3 and at most 4 points as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead.

(b) Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This criterion is determined exclusively by the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 but no more than 4 according to 538's national polling average, or will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican candidate for the US Presidential Election in 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: 

(a) The national polling average from 538 indicates that Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden for the 2024 presidential election exceeds 3 but is at most 4 points, as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden.

(b) The Republican National Convention nominates Vivek Ramaswamy as their candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This condition is determined exclusively by the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 but not exceeding 4 according to 538's national polling average, or will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the US Presidential Election in 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following situations takes place: 

(a) The national polling average from 538 shows that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden for the 2024 presidential election is more than 3 but no more than 4 points, as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when assessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. Here, a positive value signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative value signifies a lead for Biden.

(b) The Republican National Convention selects Vivek Ramaswamy as their candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This condition is determined solely by the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who is declared as the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

(b) A Yes will be given if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign provides a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will conclude with a No.

Further information and context can be found on Metaculus.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a typical Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys have consistently indicated that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas all other Democrats surveyed hypothetically either lead or are within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if Trump’s vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls close.

To calculate Trump’s vote percentage, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Others)). A YES answer is given if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A and will remain open until the designated closing time.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a standard Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% advantage among Manifold participants?

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat considered in these hypothetical scenarios either leads or is within the margin of error. Are Manifold participants reflective of the broader public opinion?

This market will be resolved with a YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls conclude.

To calculate Trump's vote percentage, the formula used is (Trump votes / (Trump votes + (Democrat in question) + Other votes)). The outcome will be YES if the difference between the percentage from poll 1 and poll 2 is 0.03 or greater. If not, the outcome will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will remain open until their designated closing time.

Surveys of public opinion consistently show that Joe Biden lags behind Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, while every other Democrat examined in these hypothetical contexts either leads or is within the margin of error. Do Manifold participants represent the wider public sentiment?

This market will be resolved with a YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll exceeds that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls conclude.

To determine Trump's vote percentage, the calculation used is (Trump votes / (Trump votes + (Democrat in question) + Other votes)). The result will be YES if the difference between the percentages from poll 1 and poll 2 is 0.03 or greater. If this condition is not met, the result will be NO.

The polls and this question will not be resolved as N/A and will stay open until their specified closing time.
