question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents? (2) Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
1. There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public? This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO. The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

2. This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (1) Will Trump achieve at least a 3% increase among Manifold respondents when compared to a generic Democrat, in the scenario of facing Joe Biden? (2) Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
1. Two Manifold polls are available, both of which conclude on July 6. One poll queries Manifold respondents about voting for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks about voting for a generic Democrat. Public opinion surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump outside the margin of error, whereas all other Democratic candidates hypothetically assessed either lead or are within the margin of error. Are the Manifold respondents reflective of the broader public? This market will determine a YES outcome if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close. The calculation for the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the result of this calculation for poll 1 minus that for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO. The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will remain open until their closing time regardless of circumstances.

2. This inquiry will be answered with Yes if reliable sources confirm that Donald Trump has testified, either in person or via remote means, regarding the trial about the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Are both of the following conditions met: (1) Will Trump achieve at least a 3% increase among Manifold respondents when compared to a generic Democrat, specifically when facing Joe Biden? (2) Is Donald Trump expected to give testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
1. Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to choose Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to select a generic Democrat. Public opinion surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas all other Democrats surveyed in hypothetical scenarios are either ahead or within the margin of error. Are the Manifold respondents reflective of the broader public? This market will resolve to YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second by 3% or more at the time of closure for both polls. The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the difference between the calculations for poll 1 and poll 2 is 0.03 or greater. If not, the outcome is NO. The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A and will remain open until the designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

2. This question will be considered Yes if reliable sources confirm that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the trial related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will the following two criteria be satisfied: (1) Will Trump see at least a 3% rise among Manifold respondents compared to a generic Democrat, particularly against Joe Biden? (2) Is it anticipated that Donald Trump will testify at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
1. Two polls conducted by Manifold are set to close on July 6. One poll inquires about the choice of Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks for a generic Democrat. Various public opinion surveys typically show Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, while other Democrats in hypothetical situations are either leading or within the margin of error. Do the Manifold respondents reflect the general public's views? This market will resolve to YES if Trump's vote percentage in the first poll exceeds that in the second by at least 3% at the time both polls close. Trump's vote percentage is calculated as (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The outcome will be YES if the difference between the results of poll 1 and poll 2 is 0.03 or more. If not, the outcome will be NO. Both polls and this question will stay open until the specified closing time and will not resolve as N/A, regardless of any circumstances.

2. This question will be deemed Yes if credible sources verify that Donald Trump has given testimony, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.body:
(a) Two polls from Manifold are available, both concluding on July 6. One poll solicits votes for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other requests votes for a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if this calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the outcome is NO.

(b) This inquiry will conclude with a YES if reliable sources indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or virtually, regarding the trial related to the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Trump achieves a minimum of 3% more support among Manifold respondents when compared to Biden rather than a generic Democrat (b) Trump gives testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:

para_P.title: Could any of the following occur: (a) Trump garners at least 3% more backing from Manifold respondents compared to Biden instead of a generic Democrat (b) Trump testifies at the hush money court case?
para_P.body:
(a) There are two polls conducted by Manifold that both conclude on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents about their voting preferences alongside Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other inquires about their preferences with a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion polls often show Joe Biden lagging behind Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat considered in these scenarios is either ahead or within the margin of error. Do the responses from Manifold participants mirror the general public opinion?

The polls and this question will remain open until the specified closing time and will not be marked as N/A under any circumstances.

(b) This question will be resolved as YES if credible sources verify that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or remotely, during the trial concerning the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that the US Core CPI will rise by over 0.1% from June to July?
para_P.body:
The answer will be YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% in comparison to June 2024.

The data for determining the outcome will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, using the precise value without rounding.

The assessment will utilize data from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will depend on the exact (not rounded) numbers.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances does not apply. Biden's own invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to be declared unfit under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is not relevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's self-invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to oust Biden from office.

para_P.title: Could Biden be deemed unfit according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Vice President, together with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to execute the powers and duties of his office" and permits the Vice President to serve as President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not pertinent to this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's self-application of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A Republican legislator urges Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) The Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another suitable authority), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to carry out the powers and responsibilities of his office" and permits the Vice President to serve as President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Poland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Poland takes part in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Poland fails to qualify, the outcome will be a **No**.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documentation, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It solely relates to whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the designated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, so that as of July 15th he is not excluded or prevented from any ballot, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

para_P.title: Will there be an authorized referendum in Scotland regarding independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Scotland conducts a referendum concerning its independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum takes place before May 3, 2024. This referendum can be classified as an "advisory" referendum; it is not required for the referendum to possess any legally binding authority.

A referendum will not be considered resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum where the UK government has refused permission for the vote, nor by a vote arranged by civil society organizations. A referendum must be recognized as having the approval of the London government.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Scotland will conduct an official referendum regarding its independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Scotland conducts a referendum concerning its independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum takes place before May 3, 2024. This referendum can be classified as an "advisory" referendum; thus, it does not need to possess any legally binding authority.

A referendum will not be considered resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum where the UK government has not granted permission for the vote, nor by a vote arranged by civil society organizations. A referendum must be recognized as having the approval of the London government.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Scotland will hold a formal vote on its independence before May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if Scotland holds a vote regarding its independence from the United Kingdom, and this vote occurs prior to May 3, 2024. This vote can be categorized as an "advisory" vote; therefore, it does not need to have any legal authority.

A vote will not be deemed settled by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style vote where the UK government has not authorized the referendum, nor by a vote organized by civil society groups. A vote must be acknowledged as having the consent of the London government.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Scotland holds an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024, and (b) the linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15, 2023?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024. This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect. It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

(b) Resolves YES if the market embedded above (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden decide to withdraw, will a reputable news organization report the event a minimum of 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question will be considered TRUE if a major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden formally announces his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage from local news, conspiracy websites, or individual comments on Manifold will not be adequate.

This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: In the event that Joe Biden withdraws, will a trustworthy news source report the situation a minimum of 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question is considered resolved as YES if a major and reputable news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement regarding his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Reports from local news, conspiracy websites, or individual comments on Manifold will not suffice.

This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden decides to step down, will a reliable news outlet inform the public at least 6 hours in advance?
para_P.body:
This question is answered as YES if a significant and credible news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provides coverage of the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation no less than 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his withdrawal through a letter, speech, or similar means.

Reports from local news sources, conspiracy websites, or individual remarks on Manifold will not be considered sufficient.

This market will be categorized as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw prior to the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This question will be resolved as YES if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as NO. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may be introduced in the future. The resolution is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) If Joe Biden withdraws, a reputable media source reports the news at least 6 hours prior (b) Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

(a) If Joe Biden withdraws, this question will be marked as YES if a major and trustworthy media organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc. Coverage from local news, conspiracy websites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not be considered sufficient. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) This question will be marked as YES if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as NO. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; other possibilities may be introduced in the future. It is determined solely by who the delegates of the Republican National Convention select.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) This inquiry will be marked as YES if Donald Trump Jr. is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as NO. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other possibilities may emerge in the future. It is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body:

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be straightforward and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make an announcement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement confirming that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will declare prior to July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This question will be deemed **Yes** if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign provides a clear, public, official announcement stating that Joe Biden will not seek or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** outcome, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should remove any chance that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such an explicit statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be accessible to the public in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Accessible to the public" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can reach it without using a VPN (though it may require a fee). If it is not available in some EU nations (as occurred in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not accessible to certain groups (such as minors), the resolution will still be **YES**, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. The resolution will still be **YES** if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting inquiries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will both of these events occur: (a) Inflection publishes a report outlining the results from an external evaluation of their safety models, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is available to the general public in the EU?
para_P.body:
(a) For Inflection, this question will be answered as **YES** if, on or before June 30, 2024, they release a *publicly accessible* report containing the results from an *independent* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) The answer will be **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Widely available" means that the typical scenario for individuals in the EU is that they can access it without needing a VPN (possibly requiring payment). If it is not accessible in certain EU countries (as seen in Italy in early 2023), or not available to (for example) minors, it will still resolve positively, provided that over 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 2 but at most 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not go beyond 3 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed in the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Will the difference in support for Donald Trump over Joe Biden surpass 2 but remain under 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved by assessing how much Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the data for July 15, 2024, which will be evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive score reflects a lead for Trump, whereas a negative score indicates that Biden is in front. For example, on July 5, 2024, the data indicates Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive score of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) experience an increase compared to the previous year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be determined by the data provided by the St. Louis Fed at this link: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The value reported for July 20, 2024 needs to exceed the value reported on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.
   
2. The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is greater than the reported value on July 20, 2023.

Both conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as YES.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 2 but at most 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will show an increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are fulfilled:

1. Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election exceeds 2 and is at most 3 points on July 15, 2024, as indicated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number signifies a lead for Trump.
   
2. The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) as reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is greater than the value reported on July 20, 2023.

Both criteria must be met for this inquiry to be answered with a YES.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden will exceed 2 but not go beyond 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will show an increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled:

1. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and at most 3 points, as stated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number signifies a lead for Trump.
   
2. The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) as reported by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is greater than its value reported on July 20, 2023.

For this question to be answered with YES, both criteria must be met.

para_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden will be more than 2 but less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will exhibit a Year-over-Year increase on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a YES response if both of the following conditions are satisfied:

1. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the presidential election is greater than 2 and not exceeding 3 points, as indicated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump advantage.
   
2. The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) as provided by the St. Louis Fed on July 20, 2024, is higher than the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

To respond with YES to this inquiry, both conditions must be fulfilled.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by their respective dates: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Will either of the following happen by the specified dates: (a) Will Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 2 and be at most 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) show a Year-over-Year increase on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as documented on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

(b) The resolution of this question will depend on the data provided by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The figure reported for July 20, 2024, must surpass the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by their specified deadlines, either of the following will take place: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but is at most 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will show an increase compared to the previous year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as recorded on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

(b) The resolution of this question will depend on the data provided by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The figure reported on July 20, 2024, must be greater than the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Will either of the following events occur by their designated deadlines: (a) On July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, Trump's lead over Biden surpasses 2 but does not exceed 3? (b) On July 20, 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) reflect an increase compared to the same date last year?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be answered based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as recorded on July 15, 2024, and verified by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates Trump is ahead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, if on July 5, 2024, the recorded value shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, that translates to a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

(b) The answer to this question will be based on the information provided by the St. Louis Fed at this link: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The value reported on July 20, 2024, must be higher than the value reported on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot for any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot for any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

This question will be resolved as "No" if these conditions are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude with a "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may happen after the specified date. It solely focuses on whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the mentioned grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Could Donald Trump potentially face disqualification or be barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This question will result in a "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or barring must be confirmed through official announcements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or credible media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will result in a "No" if these criteria are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal challenges, appeals, or subsequent changes that may occur after the specified date. It strictly examines whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal role based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the question will resolve negatively.

question.body: This question resolves Yes if at least one of the following occurs: (a) On July 17, 2024, the market capitalization of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC). (b) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a superior likelihood of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. In the event that Biden and Trump are shown to have equal probabilities, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, particularly the values represented by the blue and red trend lines on the specified resolution date. Any alterations in the method by which FiveThirtyEight computes its data will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will reach a conclusion based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It may not resolve until the July 20 data is accessible. Should there be no data available for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest preceding figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the odds of each candidate winning, expressed as a number out of 100 and reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate won will not be taken into account.

question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

If not, the question will be answered as **No**.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unable to fulfill his presidential duties under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This would be answered with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP lawmaker urges Merrick Garland to activate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enables the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Will Biden be classified as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
This will be marked as a YES if the Vice President, together with a majority of the Cabinet (or another suitable entity), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not relevant to this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not relevant.

Context: A GOP legislator urges Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is OpenAI going to make a public commitment to the principle of "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" prior to July 1, 2024?

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

This inquiry will yield a positive outcome if France secures a position in the top 5 (ties are considered positive) during the Olympics scheduled for 2024. It will result in an ambiguous resolution if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

The medal standings are determined by tallying the overall number of medals earned by each competing nation and ranking them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of ties at 1) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of ties at 2) Total Bronze Medals

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (1) At least 24 world records are established. (2) France secures a spot in the top 5 of the medal standings. The medal standings are determined by summing up the total medals earned by each participating nation, ranked by: (1) Total Gold Medals, (2) (In case of ties) Total Silver Medals, (3) (In case of further ties) Total Bronze Medals. The question will have an unclear resolution if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

The medal tally is calculated by adding the total medals won by each participating country, ranked by: (1) Total Gold Medals, (2) (In the event of ties) Total Silver Medals, (3) (If further ties occur) Total Bronze Medals. The question will be indeterminate if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater. (b) France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) The total number of world records established during the Paris Olympics reaches 24 or more. (b) France secures a position in the top 5 (ties are considered as positive outcomes) at the 2024 Olympics. (In case of a tie for 1st) Number of Silver Medals 3. (In case of a tie for 2nd) Number of Bronze Medals. The question remains unclear if the Olympics are not held in 2024.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) The total number of world records set during the Paris Olympics reaches 24 or more. question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the agreement permitting Verisign to oversee the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD be terminated by the US government prior to August 3, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially ends or allows to expire its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign that acknowledges Verisign's control over the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024. If this does not occur, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will the agreement enabling Verisign to oversee the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD be terminated by the US government prior to August 3, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be resolved as **Yes** if the US Department of Commerce (DOC) formally cancels or allows to expire its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign that acknowledges Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024. If this cancellation does not take place, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the US government end the agreement that permits Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or allows to lapse its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which recognizes Verisign's control over the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024. Should this termination not occur, the answer will be **No**.

question.body:

The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

(b) Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD).

This will be considered Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign releases a clear, official statement indicating that he will not seek or accept the nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be straightforward and definitive, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

This will be marked as Yes if the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially ends or phases out its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign regarding Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD) before August 3, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Joe Biden will declare prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, AND (b) The US government will terminate its contract with Verisign to oversee the .com TLD before August 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden make an announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's presidential nomination? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official announcement indicating that he will not seek or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election. The announcement must be explicit and definitive, leaving no doubt that Biden would decline the nomination.

(b) Will the US government conclude its agreement that allows Verisign to manage the authoritative registry for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024? This will be considered Yes if, prior to August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially cancels or concludes its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which recognizes Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD).

para_P.title: Will both of the following events take place: (a) Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the Democratic nomination for President, AND (b) The US government will end its contract with Verisign for overseeing the .com TLD prior to August 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Is it expected that Joe Biden will publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be deemed a Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official statement indicating that he will not seek or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election. The declaration must be unmistakable and final, ensuring there is no ambiguity regarding Biden's refusal of the nomination.

(b) Is it anticipated that the US government will terminate its agreement with Verisign that allows them to manage the authoritative registry for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024? This will be considered a Yes if, before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially cancels or concludes its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign, which acknowledges Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD).

question.title: Will either of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (a) Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) the US government ends its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024? This resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this resolves as No.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as detailed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is ahead by 2.4 points over Biden, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.body:

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would translate to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.body:
This question will be resolved based on the level of Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden as reflected in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number indicates that Trump is leading, whereas a negative number suggests that Biden is in the lead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be represented as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.
