question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15?
question.body:
(a) Trump's lead over Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.
(b) The linked market (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) will have at least 377 traders before market close on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Resolves YES if this condition is met, NO otherwise.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4 according to 538's national polling average, and (b) will the specified market have a minimum of 377 participants by the end of July 15?
para_P.body:
(a) As indicated by the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, Trump's margin over Biden in 538's national polling average for the upcoming presidential election will exceed 2 but remain at or below 4 on July 15, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in front.
(b) The specified market (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) is expected to attract at least 377 traders prior to the market's closure on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. The outcome will be YES if this requirement is fulfilled, otherwise NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following conditions will be satisfied: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden is greater than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) the associated market attracts a minimum of 377 traders by the end of July 15?
para_P.body:
(a) On July 15, 2024, Trump's lead over Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be more than 2 and not exceeding 4, as indicated on the chart for that date when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates Biden is ahead.
(b) The related market (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) will have no fewer than 377 traders by the market's closing time on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. The result will be YES if this requirement is fulfilled, and NO if it is not.

para_P.title: Could it be that both of these criteria are met: (a) Trump's lead over Biden exceeds 2 but is no more than 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) the corresponding market has at least 377 participants by the end of July 15?
para_P.body:
(a) On July 15, 2024, Trump's margin over Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be greater than 2 and at most 4, as shown on the chart for that date when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates Trump is ahead, while a negative figure shows Biden is leading.
(b) The associated market (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) will have a minimum of 377 participants by the market's closing time on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. The outcome will be YES if this condition is satisfied, and NO if it is not.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) the linked market get at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(b) Resolves YES if the market embedded at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will either of the following happen: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceed 2 but not go beyond 4, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) will the specified market attract at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be determined by the lead of Donald Trump over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for this question.

(b) This will resolve to YES if the market found at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g has 377 traders before the market closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will resolve to NO otherwise.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's margin over Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4 according to the national polling average from 538, or will the specified market have a minimum of 377 traders by the end of that day?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be determined by Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. For instance, if on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead by 2.4 points, that would count as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

(b) This will be marked as YES if the market found at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g reaches 377 traders prior to the market closing (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will be marked as NO in all other cases.

para_P.title: Will the national polling average from 538 indicate that Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 but less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, or will the relevant market have at least 377 participants by the end of that day?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be resolved based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden as per the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value denotes a lead for Trump, while a negative value indicates Biden's lead. For example, if on July 5, 2024, the value shows Trump leading by 2.4 points, that would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

(b) This will be recorded as YES if the market found at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g reaches 377 traders before the market closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will be recorded as NO in all other scenarios.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump Jr. going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently discussed; additional options may emerge in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump runs against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he see an increase of at least 3% among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both of which conclude on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to cast their vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a typical Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat considered in these hypotheticals either leads or is within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader public opinion?

This market will settle on YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls are finalized.

The calculation for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump votes / (Trump votes + (the Democrat in question) + Other votes)). The outcome is YES if the difference between the calculation for poll 1 and that for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the outcome is NO.

These polls and this question will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he achieve a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold voters?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other requests them to choose a typical Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public sentiment surveys frequently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat considered in these surveys either leads or is within the margin of error. Do the Manifold respondents reflect the broader electorate?

This market will be marked as YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls conclude.

The calculation for Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the difference between the percentage calculated for poll 1 and that for poll 2 is 0.03 or greater. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: Should Trump face Joe Biden instead of a standard Democrat, will he secure at least 3% greater backing from Manifold voters?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are set to close on July 6. One poll invites Manifold participants to vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to select a standard Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys often show Joe Biden lagging behind Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, while every other Democrat evaluated in these surveys either leads or is close within the margin of error. Do the responses from Manifold participants mirror the wider electorate?

This market will be deemed YES if Donald Trump's vote share in the first poll exceeds that in the second poll by 3% or more at the conclusion of both polls.

Trump's vote share is calculated as (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The response is YES if the difference between the vote share from poll 1 and that from poll 2 is 0.03 or more. Otherwise, the response is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve as N/A and will remain open until the specified closing time, regardless of any situation.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
(a) Donald Trump Jr. will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is irrespective of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Trump will gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)), and the difference between the polls must be >= 0.03 for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (a) Donald Trump Jr. is chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Trump achieves a minimum of 3% support among Manifold participants when compared to Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
(a) Donald Trump Jr. will become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This decision is independent of who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; it is strictly based on the votes of the delegates at the Republican National Convention.

(b) Trump will secure at least 3% support among Manifold respondents if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the poll against Joe Biden surpasses that in the poll against a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls conclude on July 6. The calculation employed is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)), and the difference between the two polls must be >= 0.03 for a YES outcome.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Donald Trump Jr. is chosen as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Trump achieves a minimum of 3% support among Manifold respondents against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
(a) Donald Trump Jr. will secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is appointed by the Republican National Convention as their nominee. This decision is independent of who the Republican candidate is on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Trump will receive at least 3% support among Manifold respondents if his percentage of votes in the poll against Joe Biden surpasses that in the poll against a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls conclude on July 6. The calculation used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)), and the difference between the polls must be >= 0.03 for a YES outcome.

para_P.title: Is it accurate to say that the following two events will occur: (a) Donald Trump Jr. is selected as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Trump garners at least 3% backing among Manifold participants against Joe Biden rather than a non-specific Democrat?
para_P.body:
(a) Donald Trump Jr. will obtain the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is designated by the Republican National Convention as their candidate. This choice is separate from who the Republican contender is on the day of the 2024 US election; it relies solely on the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Trump will attract a minimum of 3% support among Manifold participants if his vote percentage in the poll against Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll against a generic Democrat by at least 3% when both polls close on July 6. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)), and the difference between the polls must be >= 0.03 for a YES result.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if any of the following occur: 

(a) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first Manifold poll (with Joe Biden on the ballot) exceeds that in the second Manifold poll (with a generic Democrat on the ballot) by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + the Democrat in the question + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that Trump secures at least a 3% increase among Manifold respondents when compared to Joe Biden versus a standard Democrat?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if any of the subsequent conditions are met: 

(a) Donald Trump Jr. is chosen as the candidate by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This choice is solely based on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) The vote percentage for Donald Trump in the initial Manifold poll (with Joe Biden listed as a candidate) surpasses that of the second Manifold poll (with a generic Democrat listed) by 3% or more when both polls conclude on July 6. The calculation employed is (Trump / (Trump + the Democrat in the question + Someone else)). The resolution is YES if the result of this calculation for poll 1 minus the result for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Donald Trump Jr. will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that Trump will receive at least 3% more support among Manifold respondents when competing against Joe Biden compared to a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if any of the following conditions are met: 

(a) Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based solely on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) The vote share for Donald Trump in the initial Manifold poll (with Joe Biden listed) surpasses that in the subsequent Manifold poll (with a generic Democrat listed) by 3% or more when both polls finalize on July 6. The calculation used is (Trump / (Trump + the Democrat in the question + Someone else)). The response is YES if this calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03.

para_P.title: Could Donald Trump Jr. potentially be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or might Trump gain at least 3% additional backing among Manifold respondents when compared to a generic Democrat in a matchup against Joe Biden?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if any of the following scenarios occur: 

(a) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the delegates at the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination relies exclusively on the decision made by the Republican National Convention delegates.

(b) The percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the initial Manifold survey (with Joe Biden included) exceeds that of the following Manifold survey (with a generic Democrat included) by 3% or more when both surveys are finalized on July 6. The formula applied is (Trump / (Trump + the Democrat in question + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the result of this calculation for the first poll minus the result for the second poll is greater than or equal to 0.03.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

para_P.body:

- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Declared Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional classifications established by ISW that signify Russian control over the area



The inquiry will be answered with **No** if the location is not categorized under any of the classifications that suggest Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any additional classifications created by ISW that signify Ukrainian control over the area or the absence of Russian control over the area.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may take place after the specified date. It solely concerns whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the question will be answered negatively.

The exclusion is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these conditions are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the inquiry resolves negatively.

para_P.body:

The barring is confirmed through official announcements from state governments, judicial decisions, legal documents, or credible media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will be answered "No" if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the mentioned grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not barred or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: On June 1, 2024, will either Russia control Chasiv Yar, or will Donald Trump be barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine
- Evaluated Russian Gains in the Previous 24 Hours
- Evaluated Russian Authority
- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
- Any additional classifications established by ISW that signify Russian authority over the area

The inquiry will be marked as **No** if the area is not classified under any of the categories denoting Russian authority, which includes, but is not limited to:

- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Progress in the Previous 24 Hours
- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives
- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Activities
- Any other classifications established by ISW that denote Ukrainian authority over the area or a lack of Russian authority over the area.

(b) **Donald Trump's Exclusion from Ballot**: On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump is officially excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The exclusion or prevention is validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The inquiry will be marked as "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur *after* the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or blocked from a ballot and later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not excluded or blocked from any ballot, the inquiry resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other contenders will result in a **No**. This question may take into account new candidates introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away prior to Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be considered TRUE if there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will be deemed FALSE.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's death prior to the market's closing on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will be deemed a NO.

para_P.title: Could Joe Biden die before Saturday?
para_P.body:
A YES answer will be given if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, it will be regarded as a NO.

question.title: Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

para_P.title: Is it possible that the head of the Secret Service will step down in the upcoming 90 days?
para_P.body: Is there a chance that Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will resign, be dismissed, or otherwise cease to be the director of the Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024?

para_P.title: Is it possible that the director of the Secret Service will step down in the upcoming 90 days?
para_P.body: Is there a chance that Kimberly Cheatle, who serves as the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, will either resign, be dismissed, or otherwise cease to hold her position as director of the Secret Service prior to October 12, 2024?

para_P.title: Could the head of the Secret Service resign within the next three months?
para_P.body: Is there a possibility that Kimberly Cheatle, the current Director of the U.S. Secret Service, may resign, be removed from her position, or otherwise stop being the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

question.title: Will both Joe Biden die before Saturday and the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if and only if both of the following conditions are met: (1) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, and (2) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer serves as the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024. If either condition is not met, this question resolves to NO.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.body:

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which translates to a positive score of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. (b) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate? Resolves Yes if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves No otherwise.

para_P.body:

This resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement confirming that he will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be straightforward and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden would consider accepting the nomination. If such a declaration is not made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will there be an additional debate among Democratic presidential candidates? This resolves as Yes if a debate occurs featuring potential Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It resolves as No in all other cases.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden declares prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) there will be an additional Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
para_P.body:

The announcement must be clear and definitive, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a declaration is not made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will there be an additional Democratic party presidential debate? This resolves as Yes if there is a debate among potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. This resolves as No otherwise.

This will be considered No otherwise.

para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden make a statement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not seek the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign releases a clear, public, official announcement confirming that he will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and final, leaving no doubt regarding Biden's position on the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election. If such a definitive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, it will be marked as No.

(b) Is there likely to be another debate among Democratic presidential candidates? This will be deemed Yes if a debate takes place among potential Democratic nominees (for example, Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Otherwise, it will be considered No.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the general public in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** in all other cases.

Here, "accessible to the general public" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not available in specific EU nations (as was the situation in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not accessible to certain groups (such as minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

In this context, "ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be viewed positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems powered by Large Language Models).

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if they do not advance, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

para_P.body:
(a) The episode "House of the Dragon" S2E7 (title yet to be announced) should achieve an IMDB rating greater than 8.5, two days after its release (on July 30th), by noon PT. The rating considered will be the one shown on IMDB with standard precision (one decimal point), and this must be a strict inequality. The market will close 90 minutes following the episode's premiere. 

Context for (a):
Current IMDB ratings for HotD:
Season 1: E1: 8.7, E2: 8.3, E3: 8.7, E4: 8.4, E5: 8.5, E6: 8.0, E7: 9.1, E8: 9.3, E9: 8.7, E10: 9.2

(b) The associated market must have a minimum of 377 participants by July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. The outcome will be YES if this requirement is satisfied. The link to the market is: https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will any of the specified Israeli leaders receive arrest warrants from the International Criminal Court before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if, prior to July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below. It will be considered **No** in all other cases.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will the International Criminal Court make any arrest warrants for the specified Israeli leaders prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below before July 1, 2024. It will be marked as **No** in the absence of such warrants.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will the International Criminal Court issue any arrest warrants for the mentioned Israeli officials before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be classified as **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) releases a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli government members listed below prior to July 1, 2024. It will be recorded as **No** if no such warrants are issued.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a terrorist incident taking place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with Yes if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injury and/or death of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between, and including, the date of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the date of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The answer will be No if the aforementioned does not occur.

An incident will be classified as a 'terrorist act' if it is characterized as such by any official agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a terrorist incident taking place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered affirmatively if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injuries and/or fatalities of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), within the timeframe from the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). Conversely, the question will be answered negatively if the aforementioned conditions are not met.

An event will qualify as a 'terrorist incident' if it is classified as such by any French State agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that a terrorist event could occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will receive an affirmative response if a terrorist event in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) leads to injuries and/or deaths of at least one person, not including the terrorist(s), between the period of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). Conversely, the response will be negative if the specified conditions are not fulfilled.

An event will be deemed a 'terrorist event' if it is recognized as such by any French State authority, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Before July 1, 2024, the ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders; (2) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members:
   * Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
   * Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
   * Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

2. A terrorist attack occurs in Metropolitan France that injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024) of the 2024 Summer Olympics. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

The question will resolve as **No** if one or both of the above conditions are not met.

The question will be marked as **No** if either or both of the above criteria are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, while a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value for that date shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden exceed 2 but not go beyond 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be settled based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates Trump is leading, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden on July 15, 2024, be greater than 2 but less than 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question will be determined by the degree of Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as represented in the chart for July 15, 2024, when analyzed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number indicates Trump is in the lead, while a negative number shows Biden is ahead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump is 2.4 points in front of Biden, which corresponds to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will there be a face-to-face interview or discussion with Joe Biden on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview took place when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to inquiries for approximately 70 minutes. 

This market will conclude with a YES if Biden participates in another in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, it will conclude with a NO. 

This market does not account for press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or segments of interviews featured in programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is a minimum of 45 minutes of fresh footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such instances to be valid. A 50-minute segment could potentially only show 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, thus not qualifying. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes have all contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden engage in a face-to-face interview recorded on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview was Biden's session on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to inquiries for approximately 70 minutes. 

Should Biden participate in another such face-to-face interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, this market will resolve with a YES. If no qualifying interview is released prior to the market's closure at the end of July, it will resolve with a NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or an interview that is edited into a program like 60 Minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to be considered valid. A 50-minute video might only showcase 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, thus it would not count.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his guest spot on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 Minutes have each contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

para_P.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, during which he answered questions for about 70 minutes. 

If Biden engages in another in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes, this market will conclude with a YES. Conversely, if no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, it will conclude with a NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest spots on podcasts or late-night shows, or an interview that is edited into a program like 60 Minutes. However, there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to be deemed valid. A 50-minute video might only display 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, and thus it would not qualify.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his guest appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his prior segments on 60 Minutes have each featured less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of securing the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, this market will determine a “No” if Donald Trump is perceived to have a superior likelihood of winning the US presidential election over Joe Biden, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. In the event that Biden and Trump are deemed to have equal probabilities, this market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, particularly focusing on the data represented by the blue and red trend lines on the specified resolution date. Any alterations in the methodology employed by FiveThirtyEight to derive its statistics will not influence the outcome of this market.

This market will conclude based on the data for July 19 as soon as the figures for July 20 are released. The market may not finalize until the July 20 data is accessible. Should no data for July 19 be available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest preceding data to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the probability of each candidate winning expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (a) Tim Scott is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Joe Biden has a greater likelihood of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024.

For criterion (a), it does not matter who the Republican nominee is on the day of the 2024 US election; it is determined solely by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For criterion (b), the resolution will be based on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the statistics represented by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. Any changes in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to calculate its data will not affect the resolution of this market. If Biden and Trump have the same probability, this market will resolve as 50-50. This market will be resolved based on the data for July 19 as soon as information for July 20 is available. If there are no data points for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest previous figures to July 19.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA be the leading group in terms of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and it will be **No** for all other scenarios. In the event that two groups have an equal number of seats, both sub-questions will be resolved as **Yes**.

This question will be determined based on [official statements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA be the leading group in terms of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?

The resolution of this question will depend on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or authoritative media sources.

In cases where two groups have the same seat count, both sub-questions will be regarded as **Yes**.

The answer to this question will rely on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible news sources.

question.title: Will both the Greens–EFA and GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this query.

para_P.title: Will the advantage Trump holds over Biden in the 538 national polling average on July 15, 2024, be greater than 2 but less than 3?
para_P.body:
This question will rely on how much Donald Trump is leading Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number indicates Trump's lead, while a negative number means Biden is ahead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which is interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

question.title: Will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

2. Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

If either of these conditions is not met, the question will resolve as **No**.

This determination is based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who is declared the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

If either of these criteria is not satisfied, the inquiry will result in **No**.
