question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or any other appropriate body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office through death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not considered.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to activate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent group) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not included.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant group), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and duties of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not relevant to this question.

Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not taken into account. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator urges Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will neither pursue nor accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a **Yes** outcome, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, stating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official public statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it must eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce publicly prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a response of **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign provides a definitive and official public announcement that he will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** answer, the statement must be clear and unambiguous: it must remove any doubt that Biden would be willing to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election.

If such a clear announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 and (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following take place: (a) Biden is declared unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024 and (b) Joe Biden publicly states before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will resolve as YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question. If Biden leaves the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., it does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded. Context: A GOP lawmaker urges Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official announcement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue nor accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election. To be considered a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would consider accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following events will take place: (a) Biden is officially declared unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024 and (b) Joe Biden publicly states by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will resolve to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) formally invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). (b) This question will be answered as **Yes** if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official declaration indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. For a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unequivocal and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a conclusive statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Could it happen that both of these occurrences take place: (a) Biden is officially deemed unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024 and (b) Joe Biden makes a public announcement by July 15, 2024, stating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be answered with YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) formally invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment, declaring that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not considered. Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

(b) This question will be resolved as **Yes** if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. For a **Yes** resolution, the declaration must be unequivocal and definitive: it should remove any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a conclusive declaration is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before mid-July 2024: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 (b) Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This requires the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office," causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President. The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility of accepting the nomination.

If either condition (a) or (b) is met, this question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following events will happen prior to mid-July 2024: (a) Biden is officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment (b) Biden publicly declares he will not pursue the Democratic nomination?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if one of the following takes place:

(a) Biden is officially recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024. This necessitates that the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) formally state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office," resulting in the Vice President serving as Acting President. The length of the incapacity is irrelevant. Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not considered.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election. The announcement must be clear and definitive, with no possibility of him accepting the nomination.

If either condition (a) or (b) is satisfied, this question will be resolved as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens before mid-July 2024: (a) Biden is deemed incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 (b) Biden declares he will not pursue the Democratic nomination?
para_P.body:
This query will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August 2024. This necessitates the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent entity) to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office," resulting in the Vice President acting as President. The length of the incapacity is irrelevant. Biden leaving the office due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not included.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official declaration before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be clear and definitive, with no possibility of accepting the nomination left open.

If either condition (a) or (b) is fulfilled, this question will be resolved as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Could one of the following events occur prior to mid-July 2024: (a) Biden is declared incompetent under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment (b) Biden announces he will not seek the Democratic nomination?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs:

(a) Biden is acknowledged as incompetent under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024. This requires the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) to formally declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office," leading to the Vice President assuming the role of President. The duration of the incapacity does not matter. Biden's departure from the office due to death, resignation, etc., is excluded. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, confirming that he will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and final, with no chance of accepting the nomination left open.

If either condition (a) or (b) is met, this question will be resolved as **Yes**.

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) will collaborate with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered resolved as **Yes** if, prior to June 30, 2024, there is an official declaration of an electoral partnership or coalition arrangement between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the forthcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If such an agreement is not declared, the resolution will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will Les Républicains collaborate with the National Rally for the 2024 elections in France?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if an electoral coalition or partnership agreement between Les Républicains and the National Rally is publicly declared before June 30, 2024, as verified by [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If such an agreement is not made public, the resolution will be **No**.

para_P.title: Are Les Républicains going to join forces with the National Rally for the upcoming 2024 elections in France?
para_P.body: This question will receive a **Yes** answer if a public announcement of an electoral coalition or partnership between Les Républicains and the National Rally is made before June 30, 2024, as confirmed by [trustworthy sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If no such announcement is made, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with a Yes if the political party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to trustworthy sources.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election and (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
question.body: (a) This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**. (b) This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) The Republican Party of France (Les Républicains) will establish a political partnership with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election and (b) The Prime Minister of France will be a member of the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?

(b) This question will be answered with **Yes** if the political party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to reliable sources.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by mid-2024 in France: (a) An electoral alliance between Les Républicains and National Rally, or (b) The Prime Minister belongs to the Together coalition?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met:

(a) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

(b) On July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the party of the Prime Minister of France is Together, according to credible sources.

If neither condition is met, this question resolves as **No**.

If neither of these scenarios occurs, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If a single ballot suffices, then the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but at most 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would correspond to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4 according to the national polling average from 538 on July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be determined by the margin favoring Donald Trump over Joe Biden as reported by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the date of July 15, 2024, when analyzed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number reflects a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates a lead for Biden. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would translate to a positive value of 2.4 for this assessment.

(b) This inquiry will yield a **Yes** if Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently mentioned; additional options may emerge later. The determination of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Could Trump's lead over Biden surpass 3 but remain under 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or could Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be resolved based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden as reported in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive number indicates a Trump lead, while a negative number shows Biden in front. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

(b) This question will return a **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will lead to a **No**. This inquiry is not restricted to the candidates currently discussed; other possibilities may arise later. The decision regarding who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is not relevant; it is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a single country to secure victories in multiple women's team sports during the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold medals in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Conversely, the same NOC must have claimed victory in at least two of these competitions for the question to be answered as **Yes**.

para_P.body:

Conversely, the same NOC must have achieved victory in at least two of these competitions for the response to be **Yes**.

para_P.title: Can a single nation achieve triumphs in several women's team sports at the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:

On the other hand, for the answer to be **Yes**, the same NOC must have won in at least two of these events.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement declaring that Joe Biden will not pursue nor accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Before July 15, 2024, will Joe Biden declare that he will not be accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another Presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** outcome, the declaration must be clear and definitive: it must eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not provided before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden publicly announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not be accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear and public official announcement stating that he will not seek or accept his party's nomination for another Presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** result, the announcement must be unequivocal and definitive: it must remove any chance that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the forthcoming 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members of the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a response to voice their dissent regarding their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination ahead of schedule, which they contend suppresses the vigorous ongoing discussion about his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, serves as the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are still quite concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and, by sheer force, achieve consensus, but that’s not how it operates,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of the letter.

This market will be marked YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination proposal is signed by at least 20 members of the House or Senators who are affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market as YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will be marked NO.

para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to express their dissent against their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they believe suppresses the vigorous ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are still quite concerned about the trajectory of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a clever way to stifle debate and I suppose through sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t function that way,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He chose not to verify the existence of the letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination proposal is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if multiple letters accumulate to a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures, that would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

Should these conditions not be satisfied by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

A number of House Democrats are working together to formulate a plan to voice their opposition to their party’s effort to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they feel undermines the active discussions surrounding his candidacy, as mentioned by a lawmaker involved in this effort.

A letter that has been prepared, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, marks the first public acknowledgment from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many within their ranks remain quite apprehensive about the direction of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart way to suppress discussion and I guess through sheer pressure, achieve consensus, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He opted not to confirm the existence of the letter.

This market will be considered YES if a public letter against the early nomination plan is signed by no fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who are part of the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if several letters gather a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements, that would also be enough to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not met by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Democrats will need a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party finds it necessary to conduct multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot suffices, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if a single ballot suffices, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the Democrats require a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs several voting rounds during its roll call ballot to formally select its nominee for the 2024 US presidential election. On the other hand, if only one ballot is needed, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early:

Context from Politico:

Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be invoked to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is not relevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances does not apply. Biden's own invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP lawmaker has requested Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This is affirmed with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate entity) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and enables the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances is not included. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapable under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
This is confirmed with a YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another suitable authority), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not factor into this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidential role due to death, resignation, or similar events is not considered. Additionally, Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not included.

Context: A GOP legislator has urged Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast dated July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is seen to have a higher likelihood of winning than Joe Biden according to the same forecast for July 19, 2024. In the event that both candidates are given equal chances, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, available at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically relying on the figures denoted by the blue and red trend lines for the date of resolution. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight in calculating its data will not affect the resolution of this market.

The market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is accessible. It may not resolve until the July 20 data is available. If no data for July 19 is present by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest prior figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

It is important to note that the resolution will refer to the winning probabilities of each candidate as a percentage out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

Conversely, it will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is expected to have a greater probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. The resolution will depend on the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast, available at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically looking at the values represented by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date. It is crucial to note that the resolution will refer to the winning probabilities of each candidate as a percentage out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be factored in.

The resolution will be based on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically using the figures indicated by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date of this market. Any changes in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to calculate its figures will not affect the resolution of this market. This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 becomes available. This market may not be resolved until the data for July 20 is accessible. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest previous figures to July 19. It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the odds of each candidate winning expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be taken into account.

question.title: Will either Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, or will FiveThirtyEight project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This occurs if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) FiveThirtyEight projects Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024. This occurs if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Thus, if either (a) or (b) is true, the answer to this question will be YES.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination ahead of schedule, which they contend suppresses the crucial ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, serves as the first public indication from Democrats since the attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members remain profoundly concerned about the trajectory of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to restrict debate and I suppose through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the letter's existence.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter against the early nomination initiative is endorsed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if multiple such letters accumulate a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures, it will also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market closing, this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Could both of the following scenarios occur: (1) Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024 and (2) At least 20 Democratic members of the House or Senate publicly support a letter opposing the advance nomination of Biden?
para_P.body:
(1) Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is necessary, then the answer will be **No**.

(2) At least 20 Democratic House/Senate members publicly support a letter against the early nomination plan: This market will resolve YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by a minimum of 20 House Members or Senators from the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these requirements are not met by the market closure, then this market will resolve NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, or (b) at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

(b) Context from Politico: Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort. A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy. “It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter. This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that (a) the Democrats will experience a brokered convention in 2024, or (b) a minimum of 20 Democratic House or Senate members will publicly oppose the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then the answer will be **No**.

(b) Context from Politico: Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their dissent against their party’s attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination earlier than initially planned, arguing that it suppresses the vigorous ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative. A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still quite concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy. “It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart way to suppress debate and I suppose through sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He did not confirm the existence of a letter. This market will resolve YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is endorsed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters totaling at least 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve as NO.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than an unnamed Democrat, will he receive a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both of which conclude on July 6. One poll presents Manifold participants with a hypothetical ballot featuring Joe Biden, while the other offers a ballot with a generic Democrat.

Public sentiment surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error, whereas every other Democrat assessed in these hypothetical scenarios either leads or falls within the error margin. Are the Manifold participants indicative of the broader electorate?

This market will be deemed YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or greater when both polls conclude.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Others)). The result is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the result is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not conclude as N/A and will stay open until their scheduled closing time, regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: If voters are presented with Joe Biden instead of a typical Democrat, will Trump receive at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
There are two polls from Manifold that conclude on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to cast their votes alongside Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a standard Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys regularly indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error threshold, whereas all other Democrats surveyed in hypothetical scenarios either lead or are within the error margin. Are the views of Manifold participants indicative of the broader population?

This market will be marked as YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or more when both polls finalize.

To calculate Trump's vote percentage, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the result of this formula for poll 1 minus the result for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, it will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A, and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

The polls and this question will not be resolved as N/A and will remain open until the specified closing time, irrespective of circumstances.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has taken the stand, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" transactions involving Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Will Iran execute a military action before midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This market will settle on "Yes" if Iran carries out military operations on Israeli land, in its airspace, or within its maritime boundaries from July 30 until August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If no such action occurs, the market will resolve to "No".

For this market, a "military action" refers to any form of force used by Iran against Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime regions (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons facility in Israel, the market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian authorities or supported by a consensus of reliable reports. This encompasses, but is not restricted to, air strikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers are excluded from the resolution of this market.

Only actions by Iranian military forces that are explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have originated from Iranian soil, will be considered for the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by allied forces (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be counted towards the market resolution.

para_P.title: Will there be a military action from Iran before midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran engages in military operations on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime zones from July 30 until August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If not, it will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military operation" refers to any forceful action taken by Iran against Israeli land, airspace, or maritime zones (for example, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons facility in Israel, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or corroborated by credible sources. This encompasses, but is not limited to, aerial bombardments, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic measures will not be considered for this market's resolution.

Only actions taken by Iranian military forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have come from Iranian territory, will be counted for this market's resolution. Attacks on Israel carried out by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Will Iran undertake military operations before midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Iran conducts military actions on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime areas from July 30 until August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If this does not occur, it will result in a "No".

For the purpose of this market, a "military action" is defined as any aggressive act performed by Iran against Israeli land, airspace, or maritime regions (for instance, if an Iranian missile impacts a military site in Israel, this market will conclude with a "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian authorities or supported by reliable sources. This includes, but is not limited to, aerial strikes, naval attacks, or ground incursions. Cyber attacks, economic sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not be factored into the resolution of this market.

Only actions executed by Iranian military forces that are directly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have originated from Iranian soil, will be considered for the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel conducted by proxy organizations (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be counted in the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial and (2) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024?
question.body:
(1) This question will resolve as **Yes** if credible sources report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(2) This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the gap between Trump and Biden's polling numbers be greater than 2 but not exceed 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference in polling numbers between Donald Trump and Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump surpasses Biden be more than 2 but at most 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the difference between Donald Trump and Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure showed Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Will the gap by which Trump exceeds Biden be greater than 2 but no more than 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question hinges on the disparity between Donald Trump and Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as represented in the chart for July 15, 2024, when evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number reflects a Trump advantage, while a negative number indicates a Biden advantage. For example, on July 5, 2024, the recorded figure showed Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention anticipated for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot suffices, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the leading candidate on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is shown to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is projected to have a better probability of winning than Joe Biden according to the same forecast. Should both candidates have equal chances, the outcome will be 50-50.

The resolution will be based on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines on the date of resolution. Any changes in how FiveThirtyEight computes its data will not affect the resolution of this market.

The market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as information for July 20 is released. It may not resolve until the July 20 data is available. If data for July 19 is not accessible by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve using the closest prior figures to July 19.

Please note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.
