question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a standard Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are currently available, both set to close on July 6. One of these polls asks Manifold participants to cast their vote with Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other inquires about their vote with a standard Democrat on a similar ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public opinion frequently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat considered in hypothetical scenarios tends to lead or fall within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants indicative of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls finalize.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if this calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a standard Democrat, will he receive at least a 3% increase in support from Manifold respondents?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls are available, both concluding on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to choose Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other inquires about a generic Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error, whereas all other Democrats hypothetically assessed are either leading or within the error margin. Are Manifold respondents indicative of the broader public opinion?

This market will be marked as YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls conclude.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the result of this formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the outcome is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve to N/A and will remain open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: Should Donald Trump face Joe Biden instead of a typical Democrat, will his support from Manifold respondents rise by at least 3%?
para_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls conducted, both finalized on July 6. One poll prompts Manifold respondents to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks about a generic Democrat in the same hypothetical scenario.

Surveys of public opinion often show that Joe Biden is behind Donald Trump by a margin exceeding the error, while all other Democrats evaluated hypothetically are either ahead or within the error range. Do Manifold respondents reflect the wider public sentiment?

This market will be marked as YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll exceeds that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls conclude.

To determine the percentage of votes for Trump, apply the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the result of this formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If it does not meet this criterion, the outcome will be NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve to N/A and will stay open until the specified closing time, regardless of any circumstances.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Members or Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have informed local media that they believe Biden's prospects for victory in November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the activity is even more intense. There are several drafts of letters being shared among House Democrats, and at least one of these drafts is intended to request that Biden conclude his campaign, as per five sources familiar with the situation.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic Party members from the US House or Senate collaborates to encourage Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to actively push him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could manifest as a signed letter as mentioned earlier, or through a collective discussion with Biden where they jointly request that he withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals participate in the same group communication. If five individuals independently express to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw, this will not be adequate for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden with a request for him to step aside will not fulfill the requirements of this market unless at least five qualifying names are made public before the market concludes. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

If Trump is disqualified and later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Could it be possible that either Elon Musk attends Bitcoin Nashville 2024 or Donald Trump is disqualified from a primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered affirmatively if at least one of the following occurs: (a) Elon Musk is confirmed as a speaker at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 event, which is one of the leading Bitcoin conferences, set for July 25-27, 2024, or (b) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. 

For (b), the disqualification must be substantiated through official announcements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or credible news outlets. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not suffice for resolution. The question will be considered negative if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024. Note: This inquiry does not take into account any legal challenges, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur after the specified date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office based on the specified criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified and later reinstated, leading to him not being disqualified from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new Moana ride for Magic Kingdon at D23 2024?
question.body: This will resolve YES if Disney announces a new Moana-themed ride for the Magic Kingdom park in Florida at or before the D23 convention in August 2024. It will resolve NO if it is discussed in a "spitballing ideas" sense similar to the way that some attractions were discussed at the previous D23. It will resolve NO if a Moana ride is announced for a different theme park in Florida or elsewhere. Betting closes on August 8, the day before the convention. It will be resolved after the convention.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT by OpenAI be accessible to the public in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
The answer will be **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the public in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

In this context, "accessible to the public" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (possibly requiring a subscription). If it is not available in specific EU nations (as it was in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to certain groups (like minors), the resolution will still be positive, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" refers specifically to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to submit queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be accessible to the public in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** in all other cases.

Here, "accessible to the public" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can reach it without using a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (similar to the situation in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome as long as more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

The term "ChatGPT" refers specifically to the web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be seen as a positive outcome even if the name or website changes, provided that OpenAI's service remains fundamentally unchanged (inputting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be available to users in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will receive a **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is available to users in the EU by June 30, 2024, and a **NO** in all other scenarios.

In this context, "available to users" indicates that the typical condition for individuals in the EU is that they can access it without the need for a VPN (although it may involve a fee). If it is not accessible in certain EU countries (similar to the situation in Italy in early 2023), or if it is restricted for specific demographics (such as minors), it will still be regarded as a favorable outcome as long as over 50% of the population can access it.

The phrase "ChatGPT" specifically pertains to the web interface (not the API) used for interacting with GPT models. It will still be considered a favorable outcome even if the branding or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting inquiries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

(b) The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, the Greens–EFA will have the highest number of seats, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT will be widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024?

(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group possesses the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliament elections, and will be answered with **No** for any other results. The resolution of this question will rely on [official announcements made by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy news sources.

(b) The answer to the question will be **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is broadly accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

Here, "broadly accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is to have access without a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not accessible in some EU nations (as was the situation in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to specific groups (for example, minors), the question will still resolve positively as long as over 50% of the population can utilize it.

In this context, "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 in the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.body:

If any other candidate is chosen, it will resolve as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently announced; additional candidates may emerge later.

For this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 election; the determination is based solely on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Will the Republican Party keep control of Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly represented by Bill Johnson) during the special election in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases of conflicting reports from popular sources, an authoritative statement from an Ohio State source will be utilized. If the election does not take place before January 1, 2025, this question will be considered void.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if reliable sources indicate that an individual affiliated with the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases of conflicting reports from popular sources, a statement or source from Ohio State will be referenced. If no election takes place prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be rendered void.

para_P.title: In the upcoming special election of 2024, will the Republican Party continue to hold Ohio's 6th congressional district, which was previously represented by Bill Johnson?
para_P.body: This question will be answered in the affirmative if credible sources confirm that a candidate associated with the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In the event of conflicting information from major sources, a statement or report from Ohio State will be used as a reference. Should there be no election held before January 1, 2025, this inquiry will become invalid.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
(a) Tucker Carlson must be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of the eventual nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) A person representing the Republican Party must win the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. This will be resolved based on credible sources reporting the win, or an Ohio State source or statement if there is disagreement among popular sources. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, this part of the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Are both of the following events going to happen: (a) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) the Republican Party secures Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024?

(a) Tucker Carlson needs to be chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is ultimately chosen on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) A candidate from the Republican Party has to win the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. This will be confirmed by reliable news sources reporting the victory, or by an official statement from an Ohio State source if there is a conflict among major sources. If there is no election conducted before January 1, 2025, this portion of the question will be considered void.

(a) Tucker Carlson needs to be chosen as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. This choice is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, independent of who the eventual nominee is on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) A Republican Party candidate must win the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. This outcome will be confirmed by trustworthy sources reporting the results, or through an official announcement from Ohio State in the event of conflicting reports from major sources. If no election takes place before January 1, 2025, this part of the question becomes invalid.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either (a) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) the Republican Party holds onto Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Tucker Carlson is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) reliable sources indicate that a Republican Party representative has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. For (a), if any other candidate is chosen, it will be recorded as **No**, and the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; the decision is based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. For (b), in the event of conflicting reports from popular sources, an Ohio State source or official statement will be considered definitive, and if no election occurs before January 1, 2025, the question will be voided.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either of the following will happen: (a) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) the Republican Party manages to keep Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) reliable sources indicate that an individual representing the Republican Party has emerged victorious in the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. Regarding (a), if any other candidate is chosen, the resolution will be **No**, and it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the decision is exclusively based on who is elected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. Concerning (b), if there is a conflict among popular sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be referenced, and if no election occurs before January 1, 2025, the inquiry is void.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that one of the following events will occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) the Republican Party successfully retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the upcoming 2024 special election?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following scenarios happens: (a) Tucker Carlson is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) credible reports confirm that a Republican Party candidate has won the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. For (a), if any alternative candidate is selected, the answer will be **No**, and the identity of the Republican Party's nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; the outcome depends solely on the candidate chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. Regarding (b), in the event of discrepancies among major sources, an official Ohio State source or statement will be used, and if no election takes place before January 1, 2025, the question will be rendered invalid.

question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still hold the office of President by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if Biden continues to serve as the US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be deemed NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a YES outcome. (The role of Acting President differs from that of President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden hold the office of President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered TRUE if Biden continues as the US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be deemed FALSE if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a TRUE outcome. (An Acting President is not the same as President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden remain in the presidential position until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be regarded as TRUE if Biden stays in the role of US President until the close of July 2024 (ET); it will be considered FALSE if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President prior to that date.

A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (such as designating his Vice President as the Acting President) does not lead to a TRUE outcome. (An Acting President is not equivalent to President as per the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible for Joe Biden to continue as President until the conclusion of July 2024, or for Ron DeSantis to be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Joe Biden stays in office as US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be a NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date. A temporary power shift under the 25th amendment (i.e., designating his Vice President as the Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (An Acting President is distinct from a President according to the Constitution) OR (b) Ron DeSantis is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the nominee on election day. All other candidates will result in a NO.

para_P.title: Can Joe Biden remain in the presidency until the end of July 2024, or might Ron DeSantis be selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with a YES if at least one of the following occurs: (a) Joe Biden remains in his position as President of the United States until the close of July 2024 (ET); it will be a NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before that time. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES answer. (An Acting President is not the same as a President according to the Constitution) OR (b) Ron DeSantis is officially nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is determined solely by the choice of the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who is declared the nominee on election day. Any other candidates will lead to a NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden's advantage. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump was ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 but less than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:

In this scenario, a positive number indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative number means that Biden is in front. For example, if on July 5, 2024, the reported number indicates Trump is ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, this would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

For this market to resolve to YES, Biden must engage in another in-person interview lasting at least 45 minutes. If no such interview is available before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve to NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include podcast appearances or late-night show segments, or interviews featured in programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage showing Biden being interviewed in person. A 50-minute video might only include 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not count.

As a reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes each contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can access a compilation of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.body:
(1) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, released before the end of July 2024. Qualifying interviews include appearances on podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 Minutes, with at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed. Press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls do not count. 

(2) According to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, as reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, Trump's lead over Biden must be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points. A positive value indicates a Trump lead. The value will be checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

para_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden is required to take part in a face-to-face interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, which must be released before the end of July 2024. Acceptable interviews include those on podcasts, late-night television shows, or programs like 60 Minutes, featuring at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed. question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.body:

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic lawmakers in the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their objections to their party's initiative to finalize President Joe Biden's nomination sooner than initially intended, which they believe suppresses the crucial ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, represents the first public indication from Democrats following the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still quite troubled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and, through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He chose not to verify the letter's existence.

This market will resolve to YES if at least 20 members of the House or Senators who affiliate with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Additionally, multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members of the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to express their dissent against their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they contend suppresses the vigorous ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden be more than 2 but at most 4 based on 538's average national polls?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as shown in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when it is checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the recorded figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He declined to confirm whether the letter exists.

This market will resolve to YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if multiple letters collectively gather 20 lawmakers' signatures, that would also be enough for this market to resolve to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign releases a clear, public, official statement prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, confirming that he will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unequivocal and leave no room for interpretation that Biden would consider accepting the Democratic nomination. If neither of these situations takes place, the answer to this question will be **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but be at most 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

In this scenario, a positive number signifies Trump is ahead, while a negative number indicates Biden is in the lead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the figure reported shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which equates to a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

para_P.title: Will there be an assault on the Crimean Bridge prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if, following May 2, 2024, and preceding the specified date, [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been impacted by gunfire, explosives, or projectiles that could significantly threaten the structural integrity of the bridge.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Crimean Bridge will experience an attack prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if, following May 2, 2024, and before the specified date, [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been impacted by gunfire, explosives, or projectiles that could realistically threaten the structural integrity of the bridge.

para_P.title: Could the Crimean Bridge face an assault before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and prior to the mentioned date, [trustworthy sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been subjected to gunfire, explosives, or any projectiles that could feasibly compromise the bridge's structural integrity.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden remain in office as president until the conclusion of July?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is Joe Biden expected to remain president until the end of July?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden continues to hold the official position of president of the United States.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden still be the president at the end of July?
para_P.body: This market will result in a yes if Joe Biden is still in the official role of president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden is still president by the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. (2) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) The Crimean Bridge experiences an attack prior to July 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden remains in office as president until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the following conditions are satisfied: (1) Between May 2, 2024, and July 1, 2024, [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been targeted with weapons, explosives, or projectiles that could realistically threaten the bridge's structural integrity. (2) At 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden is still serving as the official president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) An attack on the Crimean Bridge occurs prior to July 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden remains the president at the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if both of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: (1) Between May 2, 2024, and July 1, 2024, [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) confirm that the Crimean Bridge has been targeted with weaponry, explosives, or projectiles that could significantly threaten the bridge's structural integrity. (2) At 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden is still the officially recognized president of the United States.

para_P.title: Will both of the following events occur: (a) An assault on the Crimean Bridge takes place before July 1, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden is still the president at the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body: This question will receive a response of **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) From May 2, 2024, to July 1, 2024, [trustworthy sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) verify that the Crimean Bridge has been attacked with weapons, explosives, or projectiles capable of posing a serious risk to the bridge's structural stability. (2) At 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden continues to be the officially acknowledged president of the United States.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024, or (b) Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

(b) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will take place: (a) the Crimean Bridge suffers an attack prior to July 1, 2024, or (b) Joe Biden remains president at the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if either of the following happens:

(a) Between May 2, 2024, and July 1, 2024, [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been impacted by gunfire, explosives, or projectiles that could threaten the structural integrity of the bridge.

(b) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) the Crimean Bridge suffers an attack before July 1, 2024, or (b) Joe Biden remains president by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) Between May 2, 2024, and July 1, 2024, [reputable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has experienced an assault involving weaponry, explosives, or projectiles that could threaten the structural integrity of the bridge.

(b) As of 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States.

para_P.title: Could either of these events occur: (a) an attack on the Crimean Bridge prior to July 1, 2024, or (b) Joe Biden still being president at the close of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is satisfied:

(a) From May 2, 2024, to July 1, 2024, [trustworthy sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that the Crimean Bridge has been subjected to an assault involving weapons, explosives, or projectiles that pose a risk to the bridge's structural stability.

(b) By 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024, Joe Biden continues to hold the position of president of the United States.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his intention to withdraw from the race and step down from the presidency prior to the conclusion of July?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement indicating that he is no longer pursuing re-election and that he will be resigning from his current presidential term. Such announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time; however, he is not required to have officially resigned and vacated the office by that date. A declaration of his plan to do so will suffice to resolve this market.

If he does not make these announcements, the market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will declare his withdrawal and resignation from the presidency prior to July's conclusion?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if Joe Biden makes a declaration that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he intends to resign, thereby not fulfilling the remainder of his current presidential term. Such declarations must occur before the end of July 2024, according to Pacific Time, though he is not required to have officially resigned and vacated his office by that time. A statement of his intention to resign will be adequate for the resolution of this market.

If this does not occur, the market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Could Joe Biden announce his resignation and withdrawal from the presidency before the end of July?
para_P.body:
The resolution will be YES if Joe Biden announces that he is ending his campaign for re-election and plans to resign, thus not completing the remainder of his current presidential term. Such announcements must be made before the close of July 2024, based on Pacific Time, although he is not obligated to have officially stepped down and left his position by that date. A declaration of his intention to resign will suffice for this market's resolution.

If this does not take place, the market will be resolved to NO on August 1st.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Biden will be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not applicable.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate group) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden activating section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Biden will be considered unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
This will be regarded as a YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another suitable group), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to carry out the powers and duties of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not relevant. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not relevant.

Context: A GOP legislator urges Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his role.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the specified Israeli leaders prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below. It will be answered with **No** in all other cases.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 and (2) the ICC issue arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
(1) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. The length of the incapacity does not affect this question. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden's use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not applicable.

(2) This will be considered YES if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues an arrest warrant for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below before July 1, 2024. It will be considered NO otherwise.

para_P.body:
(1) This will be considered TRUE if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another applicable authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). question.title: Will either of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (1) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4, or (2) the ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) Before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that President Biden is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office, causing the Vice President to serve as Acting President. The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff).

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following events will take place prior to their deadlines: (1) Biden being declared unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment, or (2) the ICC releasing arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials?
para_P.body:

(a) Before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President alongside a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that President Biden is incapable of fulfilling the responsibilities of his position, leading to the Vice President acting as President. The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not apply.

(b) Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues an arrest warrant for any of the following members of the Israeli cabinet: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff).

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following events will happen prior to their deadlines: (1) Biden is officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment, or (2) the ICC releases arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials?
para_P.body:
This inquiry is answered with a YES if either of the subsequent events takes place:

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment is not considered.

(b) Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues an arrest warrant for any of the following members of the Israeli cabinet: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff).

para_P.title: Could one of the following occurrences take place before their respective deadlines: (1) Biden is officially recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment, or (2) the ICC issues arrest warrants for certain Israeli officials?
para_P.body:
This question receives a YES response if either of the following events occurs:

(a) Before August 2024 (Eastern time), the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another suitable authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare President Biden unable to perform the responsibilities and duties of his office, leading to the Vice President serving as Acting President. The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden's departure from office due to death, resignation, or the application of section 3 of the 25th amendment is not taken into account.
