question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.body:

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Biden will be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be affirmed with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances does not apply. Biden's own invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Background: A GOP legislator has requested Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to oust Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Will Biden be officially deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enables the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances does not apply. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Will Biden be formally recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if the Vice President, together with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority), activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to carry out the powers and duties of his office" and permits the Vice President to assume the role of President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not pertinent to this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidential office due to death, resignation, or similar events is not applicable. Additionally, Biden's use of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not included.

Context: A Republican legislator urges Merrick Garland to activate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.title: Will the opening weekend earnings in the domestic market for "Deadpool & Wolverine" exceed the total of those for "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for **Deadpool & Wolverine** as reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) surpasses $185,548,391, which is the aggregate of the box office figures for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his intention to both withdraw from the race and step down from the presidency prior to July's conclusion?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement indicating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he will be resigning from his position, not finishing his current term. These statements must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he does not need to have officially resigned and vacated the office by that time. A declaration of his plan to do so is adequate to resolve this market.

If not, this market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

para_P.body:

It is not necessary for him to have officially resigned and vacated the office by that time; a declaration of his plans to do so will suffice to determine the outcome of this market.

If he does not make such an announcement, this market will be determined as FALSE on August 1st.

para_P.title: Could Joe Biden announce his decision to exit the presidential race and resign from his role before the end of July?
para_P.body:
This will be deemed TRUE if Joe Biden issues a statement indicating he is ending his re-election campaign and intends to step down from his presidential responsibilities prior to the conclusion of July 2024 in Pacific Time. It is not required for him to have officially resigned and left the office by that date; a declaration of his intentions to do so will be enough to assess the outcome of this market.

If he does not make such an announcement, this market will be considered FALSE on August 1st.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024, and (b) Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this component.

Otherwise, this component resolves NO on August 1st.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

The overall question resolves YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve YES.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden will declare his withdrawal and resignation from the presidency prior to the conclusion of July 2024, and (b) Donald Trump will face charges for witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement stating that he is stepping down from the race for re-election and that he intends to resign, thereby not finishing his current term. These declarations need to happen before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he is not required to have officially resigned and vacated his position by that time. A statement of his plan to do so is adequate to resolve this part positively.

If not, this segment will be deemed NO on August 1st.

(b) This will be marked as YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted regarding any remarks related to possible witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

The entire question will be answered YES only if both (a) and (b) are answered YES.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following events take place: (a) Joe Biden declares his withdrawal and resignation from the presidency prior to the conclusion of July 2024, and (b) Donald Trump faces charges for witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement stating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he intends to resign from his current presidential term. This announcement must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, though he does not need to have officially resigned and vacated his position by that time. A declaration of his plans to resign suffices for this part to resolve YES.

If not, this part will resolve NO on August 1st.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted concerning any remarks related to possible witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. These charges must be made before June 1, 2024.

The overall question will resolve YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve YES.

para_P.title: Could it happen that both of these events occur: (a) Joe Biden announces his resignation and withdrawal from the presidency before the end of July 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia prior to June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will resolve YES if Joe Biden publicly states that he is ending his campaign for re-election and plans to resign from his current term as president. This statement must be made before the close of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he does not need to have officially stepped down by that date. A declaration of his intent to resign is sufficient for this part to resolve YES.

If he does not make such an announcement, this part will resolve NO on August 1st.

(b) This will resolve YES if Donald Trump is charged or indicted regarding any comments related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. These charges must occur before June 1, 2024.

The overall inquiry will resolve YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve YES.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (1) Joe Biden announces both dropping out and resigning from the presidency, or (2) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia?
question.body:
This question resolves YES if either of the following occurs: 

1. Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient.

2. Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

If neither of these events occurs by their respective deadlines, this question resolves NO.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a YES if at least one of the following happens: 

1. Joe Biden publicly states that he is no longer seeking re-election and that he intends to resign from his current presidential term. These statements must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, although he does not need to have officially resigned and vacated his position by that time. A declaration of his plan to do so is adequate.

2. Donald Trump is charged or indicted regarding any remarks about potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

If neither of these scenarios occurs by their respective deadlines, this question will resolve as NO.

This inquiry will be answered with a YES if at least one of the following takes place: 

1. Joe Biden declares that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he intends to resign from his current presidential term. These declarations need to be made before the conclusion of July 2024 according to Pacific Time, although he does not need to have officially resigned and vacated his position by that time. A statement of his plan to do so is adequate.

2. Donald Trump is charged or indicted concerning any remarks related to possible witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The charges must be brought forth before June 1, 2024.

If neither of these occurrences takes place by their specified deadlines, the answer to this inquiry will be NO.

para_P.title: Could any of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (1) Joe Biden announces both his exit from the presidential race and his intention to resign from the presidency, or (2) Donald Trump is charged with witness tampering in Georgia?

This question will receive a YES response if at least one of the following events occurs:

2. Donald Trump faces charges or an indictment related to any statements concerning potential witnesses in *The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al*. The charges must be filed before June 1, 2024.

If neither of these events occurs by their respective deadlines, the answer to this question will be NO.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to express their dissent against their party’s move to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they contend suppresses the vigorous ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their colleagues remain significantly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman mentioned in an interview. He chose not to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Additionally, multiple letters that collectively gather 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be president by Friday and will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a letter opposing the early nomination plan?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET, based on official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting, AND (b) a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st, as reported by credible sources, including the possibility of multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures. If either condition is not met, this question resolves to NO.

question.title: Will either Kamala Harris be president by Friday or will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
This question combines two separate forecasting questions:

(a) Kamala Harris as President by Friday: This resolves to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also considered.

(b) Opposition to Biden's Early Nomination Plan: This resolves to "Yes" if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures are sufficient.

This combined question resolves to "Yes" if either (a) Kamala Harris is designated as President or Acting President by the specified time, or (b) at least 20 Democratic lawmakers sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan by the specified deadline.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Will Hurd going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

For example, a 50-minute video may only contain 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, which would not count.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention must be confirmed through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial announcements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur after the specified date. It specifically addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, leading to him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a typical Democrat on the same ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public opinion frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat hypothetically polled is either leading or within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader public?

This market will resolve to YES if Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or greater when both polls conclude.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The response is YES if the result of this formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A, and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a standard Democrat, will he achieve at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error range, while every other Democrat surveyed in hypothetical scenarios either leads or is within the margin of error. Are Manifold participants reflective of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in poll 1 surpasses that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the result from poll 1 minus the result from poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: Should Trump face Joe Biden instead of a typical Democrat, will he secure a minimum 3% rise among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are set to close on July 6. One asks participants to choose Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other inquires about a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

Surveys of public opinion consistently show Joe Biden lagging behind Donald Trump by more than the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat evaluated in hypothetical situations either leads or is within the margin. Do Manifold participants represent the general public?

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Croatia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither country qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Croatia or Malta make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Croatia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither nation qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will Croatia or Malta make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Croatia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Malta competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither nation qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will either Croatia or Malta reach the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will receive a response of **Yes** if one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) Croatia participates in a Semi-final and is later verified by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is later verified by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither country qualifies, the response will be **No**.
